title: Wilson's Tales of the Borders and of Scotland, Volume 04
author: Various
snippet: "I want to be about with Bogend andGlenmuck, who refused me their dochters.

title: Wilson's Tales of the Borders and of Scotland, Volume 04
author: Various
snippet: Somehow oranother, the other proprietors around, such as Bogend and Glenmuck,pretended to discover that their blood was thicker than that of theGeddeses, and not a scion of their stocks would they allow to beengrafted on the good old oak of Cauldshouthers.

title: Wilson's Tales of the Borders and of Scotland, Volume 04
author: Various
snippet: You are, perhaps, of theold Hamiltons of Cauldcoats, or the Bertrams of Duckpool, or the Haysof Glenmuck, or the old tory lairds of Bogend, Hallmyre, or Windylaws,and may challenge us, like a true knight, for endeavouring to reduce thegrandeur of your compeers; and therefore, to keep peace, we will becontented with the admission that Gilbert Geddes was the thane, or, asMiss Joanna Baillie would have it, according to the distinctionindicated in the line, "the _thanies_ drinking in the hall," thethanie--that is, the lesser Thane of Cauldshouthers, in the shire ofPeebles.
